1222222221111221221211212211121121122112.content:
"Listen you, as long I'm bigger than you are, I'm the one in charge, got it!?" Jihl spat angrily. Her defeat had humiliated her more than she let on at first, and it showed in the way she now handled herself. Already she was nearly crushing the tinier Cloud of Darkness in her hand again.

Cloud of Darkness huffed, but didn't say anything in response to Jihl. She thought the larger woman was losing it, and decided then that it would be better to wait until she could turn the tables on Jihl somehow.

Satisfied that she had scared Cloud of Darkness into submission, Jihl took the tiny woman with her and headed back to her now giant clothes pile.

Meanwhile, Dagger had been searching Jihl's clothing for a while now with no sign of the shrunken woman being in there. Dagger started to think that Jihl might have shrunk herself to oblivion with her last move. The young summoner was all but ready to give up her search when she heard a loud squeaking noise behind her. She turned, still kneeling, and saw that it was Zidane and the others who had shrunk, they all seemed to be safe. And then there was Yuna, who Dagger was now seeing for first time after the older summoner's shrinking ended, Dagger noted Yuna was half of Zidane's height. As they got closer Dagger could hear Zidane's voice more clearly.

"Dagger! Over here!" The tiny man shouted. He pointed to Lighting's hand and then gave a thumbs up, to signify that the smaller members of the group were all okay. "We're all safe!" He shouted.

"Oh, Zidane, Lighting, Yuna, thank goodness you're all okay!" Dagger said.

"And you too, Dagger!" Zidane yelled up to the giantess summoner with a smile. "You really stuck it to that Chaos broad!"

"Yes, we were watching from afar. Zidane couldn't keep his eyes off of you!" Yuna said with a laugh.

"Hey, can you blame me?" Zidane smirked.

"I have to admit, it was pretty impressive. Good work, Dagger." Lightning added.

"Thanks, but that was way too close a call. I don't think I could handle another fight like that anytime soon." Dagger admitted.

"Hey, don't worry about it!" Zidane said, giving Dagger's knee a pat. "You've already done so much for us, I think you deserve a break!"

"Yes. Thank you." Yuna chimed in.

"Thanks, everyone." Dagger smiled. She looked at Yuna. "And Yuna, I'm sorry to see you end up so small."

"That's alright. As long as I can still be of help to everyone, I'm okay." Yuna said. "But what about you? What are you doing now?"

"Oh right!" Dagger said, turning back to the clothes. "Jihl shrunk into her clothing, so I was hoping to be able to get her out of there."

"Which reminds me... Dagger, we lost Cloud of Darkness." Lightning explained.

"What!? She's missing, you mean?" Dagger asked.

"Yes. It happened when we were dropped. We don't know where she is, or if she's even still alive." Lightning stated.

"But it's not a big deal, though. It's not like she'll be able to hurt us, she's way too small to do anthing." Zidane said. "On her own at least. And she's too small to be seen by anyone else, so we don't have anything to worry about."

Dagger sighed, whether out of relief or worry, she didn't know. But she did know that this meant that there was just one less thing to worry about now. And so, Dagger shrugged it off and went back to looking for Jihl in no time. Zidane and the others that were able to agreed to help her look.

What Dagger and the others didn't know, was that Cloud of Darkness, being held almost against her will by the newly shrunken Jihl, was right next to them. Jihl's plan involved just waiting for the right opportunity to strike. So the two tiny villainess' stood by, hiding behind some clothes, and watched as Dagger and her smaller friends searching through Jihl's clothes.

12521112.content:
Robin and Lucina quickly shrank down into their clothes, unaware of the whole ordeal though as they were both unconscious. Their bodies receded smaller and smaller into their clothes, effectively leaving the two in the nude. Tiny and unconscious, the two were basically helpless as the seconds passed, luckily no one was passing by at the time, so they stayed undisturbed during this time.

But soon, Robin and Lucina were both awake and shocked to find themselves naked and covered by huge cloth.

"Lucina!" Robin called out from still inside his clothes, his cry was mangled by the huge cloth, but Lucina still heard it.

"Robin! I'm here!" Lucina shouted. "I-I'm inside... My clothes!?"

Their oversized outfits were more than enough to cover them now, but still easily identifiable to the two shrunken people. Robin and Lucina realized their predicaments at the same, they had shrunk and were laying inside their own clothes, now giant sized to the shrunken couple.

"Lucina, we've shrunk!" Robin stated.

"Yes, I've realized as much... Unfortunately." Lucina said.

"We need to get out these clothes." Robin said.

Lucina hesitated for a moment, despite being with romantically involved with the him, she still blushed slightly at the idea of Robin seeing her in the nude. "... Right!" She said at last. "I'll meet you outside."

And with that, Robin and Lucina both crawled their way through their giant clothing, a task that they found was actually rather easy. They were soon both outside, having crawled out onto the grassy plains of the mushroom kingdom.

"Lucina?" Robin asked when he didn't see her anywhere.

"Over here!" He heard Lucina shout.

Robin looked behind himself and saw what appeared to be Lucina's discarded clothes, now giant to the tiny man. He ran over to them, finding Lucina down by her skirt.

"Lucina!" Robin repeated.

"Robin!" Lucina ran up to him and gave him a hug. The two embraced for a while.

"So... How do this happen?" Lucina asked, stepping back.

"That mushroom we touched must've been a poison mushroom." Robin explained, pacing around in the giant pile of his clothes. "They're strange food on this world that shrink whoever eats it, or touches it, it seems.

"So that was a poison mushroom..." Lucina said, thinking about the strange objects this world had. "But wait, don't poison mushroom's usually shrink your clothes as well?"

"Yes, I've heard that as well." Robin said. He looked down, trying to remember what else he'd read about the mushrooms. "And not only that, but they usually don't make you so small. Perhaps it's a different type?"

The two contemplated the idea, before Lucina spoke again.

"Well, whatever. This should wear off soon, right?" She asked.

"I think so..." Robin said, sounding unsure. "But even if it doesn't, I believe we might be able to restore our sizes quickly anyway using a super mushroom."

"That's right!" Lucina smiled, hitting her fist into her open hand below in a eureka kind of way. "Good thinking Robin, shall we try that then?"

Robin and Lucina walked along the path. They were both a little uneasy at first from being small, but soon relaxed. Enjoying the lush, green scenery of the Mushroom Kingdom. It was quite different from back home, but they had a pleasant walk, well, as pleasant as a walk can be when you're two inches tall. If it weren't for their small sizes, Robin and Lucina would be having a nice, romantic stroll about now. Unfortunately that was not the case. But the two made the best of it, enjoying each others company and making small talk.

Eventually the two came across some more blocks floating high above them in the air, they seemed even higher up then before at the couples tiny sizes. Robin and Lucina looked up at the question blocks.

"I bet there's a super mushroom in one of those!" Lucina said enthusiastically.

"I think you're right, Lucina." Robin agreed. "But we're too small to even reach them! It's not like before, we'll have to be smart about this and think of a way to get up there."

"You're right, hmm..." Lucina pondered how to reach the blocks.

The two stayed there for a while, trying to think up a solution to this problem. Robin paced around some more, while Lucina stared straight up at the blocks. Their floating state seemed to taunt the shrunken swordswoman, who just couldn't seem to think of anything. Robin wasn't faring much better though, somehow nothing was coming to the tactician. There was nothing nearby that could really help them, just a few rocks here and there.
At one point, Robin suggested out of desperation that Lucina climb up on his shoulders and try to hit the blocks from on top of him, and she hesitantly agreed to try. But this plan failed when the blue haired girl jumped up, completely missing the block far above her head, and tumbled back down to the ground, earning herself a nice bruise on her rear, and earning Robin a deserved scolding and playful beating from the girl.

A half hour had passed, and the tiny two were no closer to figuring out how to reach the blocks. Robin and Lucina were now laying in the grass, tired from the whole ordeal.

"I think it's time we leave." Robin offered. "There must be another way to find a super mushroom somewhere."

"Yeah. I have to agree." Lucina said.

The two got up and were about ready to leave, when all of a sudden, someone was approaching their location! They could hear the giant footsteps coming their way.

"Someone's coming!" Lucina exclaimed. She prepared herself to fight, if need be. Although she wasn't sure how she'd do that without her weapons.

"We need to hide!" Robin said. He didn't trust being found in this state.

Robin and Lucina ran behind a nearby rock, one that was large enough for the tiny couple to hide behind. They then peeked out from behind it and saw someone, someone that huge to them! Not only that, it was a human, not one of the many strange creatures that the mushroom kingdom was home to. But because both of them were new to smash, they haven't really had time to familiarize themselves with the rest of the crowd as of yet. All they knew was that there was a normal sized person before them.

"Who is that?" Robin asked quietly.

"I'm not sure." Lucina whispered her reply. "I hope they're friendly..."

The giant appeared to hear them, and turned towards their direction, causing the shrunken couple to quickly duck back into cover.

Rosalina's search for the source of the noise didn't take long, there were only a few rocks and things to look behind anyway. Soon she found the source of the squeak, two tiny people, hiding behind a rock. They seemed to be looking up at her in fear, or caution from what she might do to them. And since they didn't look of this world, she thought they must be foreigners from another, that would explain why they seemed so scared by their shrinking at least. 12521112122111.content:
"She's the same size as us." Lucina noted.

"Yeah." Robin said. "But that's to be expected, isn't it? We all got affected by the same mushroom after all."

"I suppose so." Lucina said. "There's just so much about these other worlds that doesn't make sense though!"

"I'm with you, Lucina." Robin agreed.

The two stood around for a while, waiting for their new friend to wake up. There wasn't much to do while they waited. Robin's eyes started to wander though, and they seemed to keep going back to the shrunken, naked woman before him.
She was beautiful, he had to admit, her smooth skin and pretty, blonde hair, with a side covering one of her eyes, giving her a mysterious look. Then there was the rest of her! Robin was ashamed to admit it, but he couldn't help but look at the beautiful blonde's breasts and hips, both bigger than Lucina's! He mentally scolded himself for thinking that, and he was glad that his girlfriend seemed to be occupying herself with other things at the moment. But then, as his eyes wandered back to the blonde haired woman's exposed body, her eyes started to flutter open, slowly at first, but fast enough that Robin couldn't avert his gaze in time.

"Hmm?" Rosalina asked, sounding a little groggy.

Rosalina looked up and saw Robin staring at her. Then, as if on unfortunate cue, a cool breeze blew through the air and Rosalina felt it all over her now exposed body and looked down. She let out a little squeak, but didn't try to cover her nude body. Robin blushed and hurriedly looked away. The tactician ended up looking at right Lucina, who rolled her eyes at the scene and mouthed "please". She helped Rosalina up.

"Are you alright, can you stand?" She asked the blonde haired woman.

"Y-Yes. I think so." Rosalina said. She let Lucina help her up, and stood to new height of 2 inches tall, the same as Robin and Lucina.

"You're as small as us." Robin noted. His face was still red from embarrassment, Rosalina seemed to notice this and gave him a reassuring smile. That was enough to ease his embarrassment, at least a little. It amazed him with how at ease this woman made him feel.

"It's alright." She said. The blonde haired woman still hadn't make any effort to cover herself. "It seems we're all in the same position here."

"I-If you say so..." Robin said nervously. He glanced at Lucina, worried that she might be upset if he stared at the other woman for too long. But to his surprise, Lucina seemed fine with it, even smiling back at him, and to Rosalina. This regal-seeming woman seemed to be affecting her as well.

"There's nothing to be done about it." Lucina said in a matter of fact way. Robin breathed out in relief at hearing his girlfriend's words. Lucina continued, "I'm just glad you're alright. Sorry for getting you involved in this."

Rosalina shook her head. "No, I wanted to help, and still do." She said with a smile.

"Thank you." Lucina said. Robin also chimed in with thanks.

Rosalina got up a took a few steps around. There was a clear look of wonder on her face that threw Robin and Lucina off for a second, they thought a native of this world would be used to such things happening. If the high amount of blocks around told them anything, it was that super and poison mushrooms should be a regular occurrence here. Just as Lucina was about to ask Rosalina about it, the blonde spoke.

"So this is what happened to you two." Rosalina said. "That explains that, I suppose."

"Explains what?" Lucina asks.

"Well, you see, normal mushrooms, super or otherwise, always change whatever the user as on with them as well as the user." Rosalina explained. "And a poison mushroom wouldn't shrink us so small, and the mini mushroom would make us smaller than this... That's why this is so strange to me."

"I see." Robin said. "Lucina, you were right."

Lucina nodded at Robin, then faced Rosalina. "So what you're saying is, the mushroom that we touched wasn't normal?" Lucina asked.

"Yes." Rosalina answered.

"Then where in the world, or worlds, did these come from?" Lucina wondered.

"I'm not sure." Rosalina said. "But they are certainly not of this world."

"Hmm... That's strange." Robin said. "But still, we can't just stand around here and talk. I think it's time we take action, and try to reverse the effects of that strange mushroom."

"Yes, I agree." Rosalina said. She thought for a few seconds before speaking again, "If you want to reverse the effects, then it's probably best to try finding a super mushroom. Hmm, or maybe..." She said, her head hung down and sort of mumbling it to herself, as if she were just thinking out loud. But then she perked up and revealed her solution.

1252111212211112.content:
Robin, Lucina and Rosalina walked along to the castle, with Rosalina leading the way. All three still tiny and naked, but despite this they were somehow able to enjoy themselves. The path that Rosalina took them on had been clear until now, devoid of any life, enemy or other. But then, after several more minutes of walking, the group came across a dark scene.
They had just crossed over a hill and were looking over at the other side of it. Where there was an odd looking man next to a familiar face, or hand rather, it was Master Hand, the evil tyrant who tried to keep the original eight smashers as his playthings forever. Robin, Lucina and Rosalina were newcomers to the event, but even they had heard of this villain's nefarious deeds from their friends who had joined before them.

"That's Master Hand!" Lucina gasped.

"Yes, I've heard of him before." Rosalina stated. "Peach told me all about him. Be careful you two, this isn't someone who will help us."

"Marth and Ike told us about the same." Robin said. Rosalina nodded, she seemed to understand, but really, had no idea who he was talking about. "But who's the other one?"

"I'm not sure." Rosalina whispered.

The odd looking man, was a mystery to them though. His whole appearance was strange, almost digital in the way he looked. His body was blue and he floated around, menacingly. But nobody in the group had heard of him, so they had no idea what to expect. They simply watched the two in silence.

Robin, Lucina and Rosalina were too far to hear what was being said, but they could see it well enough. Master Hand seemed to be taking orders from the blue man, whose movements were sporadic as he pointed in all sorts of directions. The Master Hand seemed to nod, as much as a hand could nod. Then the blue man stopped suddenly, he looked to be conjuring up something from his hand. The group all gasped when they saw one of the strange mushrooms from before pop out of thin air and onto the blue man's hand, they were all surprised, but continued to watch.
The blue man gave the mushroom to Master Hand, who was unaffected by it's shrinking powers, and he made a fist, when he opened up again, the mushroom was gone.

"He took it..?" Robin asked quietly.

"I think so." Lucina whispered in reply.

The group continued to watch. The blue man now pointed in a specific direction, and shortly after, Master Hand floated off in that way. The blue man then seemed to laugh maniacally to himself before disappearing. Robin, Lucina and Rosalina were pretty shook up by what they just witnessed. But with the two villains gone, they could relax a little.

"So that blue... Thing. He's the one behind it!" Robin said.

"It looks that way." Lucina said. "Lucky us, huh? To catch such a revealing scene? Now we know who we're up against!"

Lucina sounded confident, she looked over her two comrades with a renewed, almost cocky grin. She was ready to kick some hand. But then she saw Rosalina, and the worried expression on the other woman's face was one of horror.

"What's wrong, Rosalina?" Lucina asked.

"Master Hand..." Rosalina started. "He's heading straight for Princess Peach's castle!"

"What!?" Robin shouted.

"Oh, no!" Lucina exclaimed. "We have to hurry!"

Robin and Lucina looked at each other and nodded. Lucina took Rosalina's arm and looked her in the eyes.

"It's going to be okay." She assured her. "We'll beat him to the punch, we'll get there before he does!"

Rosalina still looked shocked, but eased up a little after hearing what Lucina had to say, she smiled faintly.

"Yes. Let's go." Rosalina said.

"Okay, lead the way, Rosalina!" Lucina said.

Rosalina showed the two the way to the castle, and they all took off for it.

Next...

12521112122111121211211211121111111.content:
All four members of the group instantly grew back to their normal sizes upon touching the Super Mushrooms. Their job done, the mushrooms then disappeared in a flash.

"It worked!" Peach exclaimed. Despite how much she enjoyed being tiny for the last night, the Mushroom Kingdom princess was grinning ear to ear after recovering her lost height. The bubbly princess was practically bouncing around the place, she went and hugged everyone in the group.

"Great, now we can go and stop Master Hand!" Lucina said with determination, she pumped her fist in the air.

"Yes, this certainly puts the odds more in our favor." Rosalina said. Peach snuck up behind her and attacked her with a hug, the cosmic princess looked shocked for a moment and turned to see that it was just Peach, she smiled and turned around, returning the hug.

Robin and Lucina shared a hug of their own, and a little kiss. Then the two looked and saw Rosalina and Peach and were surprised at the height difference between the two, Peach only came up to Rosalina's chest.

"Wow, Rosalina, did you get two mushrooms?" Robin asked.

"No." Rosalina shook her head, and Peach let go of her. "This is my normal size."

"Wow, you're so... tall..!" Lucina said with clear amazement.

"Hmm, yes, well, I think we should all deal with the situation at hand." Rosalina said, trying to turn the conversation away from her height.

"What's that?" Peach asked.

Rosalina gestured to herself, and everyone knew at that moment what she meant. "We're all still naked." She said.

Robin and Lucina blushed, somehow the two hadn't noticed yet in their excitement. Peach didn't seem bothered though.

"It's fine if it's just between us." Peach said.

"Yes, but we need to go out into the kingdom, Peach." Rosalina said.

"Why?"

"The portals." Rosalina stated. Referring, of course, to the various portals located on each world for the fighters, and spectators, of each world to participate in the smash tournament. The Mushroom Kingdom had several of these portals, unfortunately, none were in or around Peach's castle, so the group would have to go out to find them.

Then a lightbulb went off in Robin's head upon hearing Rosalina say it. He lightly pounded one of his fists into his open hand in front of himself. "So that's it!" Robin shouted.

"You understand where I'm going?" Rosalina asked.

"Yes, at least, I think so." Robin said with a nod. "It's about that Master Hand villain and his blue ally, isn't it?"

"Yes. I've been thinking and I believe it's clear what those fiends are up to." Rosalina stated. "The Master Hand and his cohort are going to different worlds and shrinking the fighters there."

"So if we take the portals to other worlds, we may be able to catch up them and stop them!" Robin exclaimed.

"That's right." Rosalina said.

"I see." Robin said. "But we have to act fast, before anyone else is affected by their schemes!" Robin turned to Peach, who at the moment was hugging Lucina again, the blue haired girl seemed a little miffed by Peach's display of affection. "Peach, you understand, right?" Robin asked Peach. "We really should get dressed and ready to go, for the sake of our friends!"

Peach smiled and ran ahead to the way back into the castle. "Sure!" She shouted on the way. "Follow me!"

Peach lead the group inside her castle again, this time showing them her extensive wardrobes. They were mostly filled with clothes more fitting for Peach's toad guards and servants. But she also had some normal sized clothes for the group, collected from other worlds, she told them. Lucina picked out a plain blue shirt and jeans, while Robin wore a purple hoodie with jeans.

After the tactician and swordswoman got dressed and ready they went downstairs to find Peach in her usual attire, and Rosalina was wearing her usual outfit as well.

"I just can't go without my favorite dress, you see." Peach told them with a smile as they walked down the stairs.

Robin smiled and nodded at her, before turning his attention to Rosalina. "Are we all ready then?"

"I think so." Rosalina replied.

"And now that we're back to normal, we can get there easily!" Lucina exclaimed, her cocky grin returning. "This is great, nothing can stop us now!"

Lucina was fired up, excited to be back to normal size and to also be capable of taking down the Master Hand. Her confidence showed as she started to take the lead of the group, walking ahead of them at a fast pace.

"She's quite determined, isn't she?" Rosalina asked Robin.

"Oh, yes. Very much so." Robin replied.

"Yeah, and she's about to leave us behind!" Peach exclaimed, and she ran to catch up with the blue haired swordswoman.

"Oh my, we should hurry." Rosalina said.

Robin nodded and the two picked up their pace, matching Lucina's and catching up to her and Peach.

Next...

A collective cry of "Aahhh!" came out of them as they instantly shot down in size once more. A second later they were all down to only 3 feet tall and standing in over-sized clothes! This went unnoticed by them for a moment though, as they were all too preoccupied with recovering.

"Is it over?" Lucina asked.

The girls then tried standing up too, and all found that, despite their reduced sizes, they all felt normal again as well.

"Yeah, it's like I'm back to normal." Lucina said. The blue haired girl looked her companions over, and then down at herself, noticing something was off, mostly her clothes! "Ahh! I shrunk again!" She shouts.

Lucina's outcry made everyone else take notice of their sizable predicament as well. Their clothes were all practically falling off of them, they wondered how they hadn't noticed it before. Despite their wardrobe malfunctions, none of them bothered to cover themselves up, feeling safe amongst each other.

"Oh no, she's right, we're all about half our size!" Robin said. Then, looking to Rosalina, he added, "Well, most of us."

"Hmph." Rosalina said, a little irked by Robin's remark. "Yes, but I'd estimate us at being only about three feet tall each."

"The portals, maybe?" Robin offered his explanation. "Peach, could the portals have caused something like this?"

Peach shook her head. "No, it's never happened to me before." She said.

Peach shook her head again. "I don't know." She said.

"I think you're right, Lucina." Robin said. "But now that begs the question, could it happen again?"

Everyone went silent after Robin posed his question. They knew the possibility was there, and didn't want to think it could happen again, but it could.

"Well, even if it does happen again, and we do get smaller, we can just deal with it like we did before!" Lucina said confidently.

"Well said, Lucina." Rosalina said.

"I have to agree with Lucina, we'll just have to deal with it when the time comes." Robin said.

"Okay then." Peach said, pulling up her dress so it fit somewhat, although it looked like she was a child playing dress-up. "Let's get going!"

"To Hyrule castle!" Lucina exclaimed.

"Not really, my memory of that time is still a little fuzzy, but... oh my goddesses! I-I do remember some things!" Zelda said, her eyes going wide and her face turning a deep red as she recalled how she sexed up Lucina earlier.

"D-Does this mean, that was all the potion's doing?" Lucina asked quietly. "You don't feel anything towards me now?"

"N-No! Of course not!" Zelda said. "I, well, I do remember enjoying it... and I know that wasn't all the potion's doing."

"So..?" Lucina asked, letting her question linger.

"I, uhm, I wouldn't be opposed doing something like that again... with all of you." Zelda admitted shyly.

Lucina smiled at this, and so did the rest of the group, knowing they had got another member to join the harem; not that it was their goal, but it was nice.

"Great!" Peach exclaimed, she was bouncing now. "You wanna again right now!?"

"U-Uh..." Zelda stammered.

"Let's..." Robin began, grabbed Peach and taking her away from Zelda before continuing, "... try and get out of this room first."

"Aaahhh, okay." Peach sighed in defeat.

Zelda and Lucina shared a laugh at Peach's over-the-top antics, they looked at each other and smiled, before blushing again and looking away quickly before anything could happen.

Meanwhile, Robin and Rosalina had gathered around the potions once again.

"So, who's going to try and take one this time?" Robin asked the group.

"I don't think Zelda should try." Rosalina said.

"No, don't worry, I'm up for trying another potion." Zelda said. "After all, what are the odds there are two potions that make you, um, well, so horny?"

"Really?" Rosalina asked. Zelda nodded. "Well, okay. If you think you're up for it." Rosalina said.

Who tries the potions?

The blue potion's effects took place much more quickly then the pink one, Zelda could almost immediately feel some changes coming on. Unfortunately for Zelda, she quickly realized that the potion's effects were making her shrink! There was a collective gasp from the rest of the group as they all noticed Zelda shrinking again.

"N-No!" Zelda cried as she shrank at a fast rate.

Lucina rushed to Zelda side, comforting the once again shrinking princess.

"I don't know." Rosalina replied. "Let's hope she doesn't get too small."

Zelda continued to shrink, until less then a minute later, her shrinking stopped. The Hyrulean princess was now only half her previous size, a tiny 6 mm tall!

"It's over... thank the goddesses!" Zelda sighed in relief.

"Thank goodness you didn't shrink into nothing!" Peach exclaimed.

"One of these has to help us." Robin said. "It just has to!"

"Would you like to try one then?" Rosalina asked him, holding up another two potions.

Robin grew bigger and bigger as the girls all watched in awe, they had to admit he was quite a bit more handsome at his bigger size. He was quickly becoming a giant protector for the girls.

About a minute later, Robin's growth stopped. He wasn't nearly his normal height, not even close, although he was much, much bigger than before. He looked down at the shrunken girls beneath him, they looked so small at his new perspective. He could hear them speak.

"Oh." Rosalina said softly. She blushed, it was clear to her that Robin's larger size was having an effect on her, but she didn't mind, she liked him like this, being so big.

"Robin, you're huge..!" Lucina gasped. It was the first time she had been smaller than her boyfriend since they shrank, and she much the same feelings about it as Rosalina. "I can't believe it!"

"... he's so big..." Zelda whispered. At her even more reduced size, Robin was an even bigger giant to the brunette princess.

"You're so big!" Peach exclaimed, running over to the giant and hugging his leg, which was bigger than her entire body! "I love you like this!"

"Thanks, Peach." Robin said. "I think you can all join me at this size. Try taking some of the yellow potion, I made sure not to drink it all, so there should be some left."

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Robin looked over at the tinier Hyrulean princess, wondering what he should do.

Zelda looked up at the much taller Robin with a fleeting lust, she wondered if that was because of the effects of the pink potion or simply because he was so astounding to behold at her size. Either way, she knew she liked him big and, in a moment of weakness and delusion, she nodded at the giant to drink the potion again.

"Please, take some more if you think it will help." Zelda tells him, her voice wavers a little and she begins to sweat at the thought of Robin getting bigger before her. She's starting to see why Peach likes being small so much.

"Okay, here goes. But this is just to test the theory." Robin said, taking another sip from the bottle of yellow liquid, before handing the potion back to Peach.

Robin grew once more until he surpassed Rosalina's height, but only just barely, he now stood 16 inches tall, an increase of four inches.

"So you're bigger than me now." Rosalina said, eyeing the young man who was once again taller than her. "But not by much."

"Yeah, I'd say I only grew about four inches taller. So I'm an inch taller than you." Robin said.

Lucina went over to Peach and knocked her over the head.

"Oww!" Peach cried. "What was that for!?"

"Don't take Zelda's chance to grow away like that!" Lucina shouted at the blonde.

"Oh, don't be jealous, Lucy!" Peach said, smiling mischievously. "Here, you can grow some too!"

Peach suddenly and swiftly grabbed Lucina's by her chin and poured some yellow potion down her mouth. Lucina, shocked by this, swallowed the liquid. Peach laughed as the blue haired swordswoman quickly shot up in size, growing to two inches tall, and much taller than the princess herself.

"Peach!" Robin shouted, shocked that Peach would get so rough. He held out his palm, to tell her to stop, but it was too late, the damage was done.

"Hey, stop doing that!" Lucina shouted, spitting out yellow potion from her lips. She backed away from the now smaller-to-her Peach, shouting, "Zelda should have a sip before you waste it all!"

Peach turned to look at Zelda, who had a pleading look in her eyes. Peach felt bad for her friend, she stopped fooling around and went and offered the bottle of yellow potion to her smallest friend.

"There's still some left..." Peach said with sadness, being disappointed in herself. Her fun was fun while it lasted, but now she felt just awful. "Here."

Zelda smiled warmly at Peach. "Thank you." She said, taking the bottle from her, it was small enough for her to easily hold.

Zelda brought the bottle to her lips and drank from it, consuming the last of the yellow liquid inside. This would leave Peach with no chance to grow afterwards, but the Mushroom Kingdom princess knew this before handing it to her smaller friend, and was fine with that, accepting it as a sort of punishment for her reckless earlier actions.

In a few seconds that changes began, but they were not what anyone expected. Whether it was from everyone sapping all the magic power of the potion from drinking it so much or from a perhaps combined effect of the other potions Zelda took, they didn't know. But as the clock ticked on, it was clear to them that the potion was not affecting the Hyrulean princess in a positive way.

Which was that...

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.title: Blame and Admiting the truth.

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Robin heads up the table first, climbing up a leg of the large furniture. Rosalina follows behind him. The other all watch and hope for the best for the two largest members of the group to reach the top.

"I never thought *huff* something like this would be a problem..!" Robin pants as him and Rosalina make it halfway up the table leg, with Rosalina a little further behind him. Robin looks down at her while still climbing. "How are you holding up, Rosalina?" He asks.

"I'm doing okay." Rosalina says, not sounding stressed from the exercise at all.

"Good..!" Robin says. He was impressed by how strong the cosmic princess is. He had to admit, he was having some trouble climbing the table himself.

The two pressed on, eventually making it all the way up to the top of the table. Robin pulled himself up, then helped Rosalina by pulling her up. The tactician took a minute to catch his breath. Rosalina stood by his side and watched, she didn't seem tired at all, not even have broken a sweat!

"How can you be so relaxed?" Robin asked, genuinely curious.

"I come from space." Rosalina told him with a smile. Robin looked confused at this answer, so she went on to explain, "Gravity, and the manipulation of it, is something I'm used to. I can make myself heavier or lightly a I please without changing my body's shape. That's why I could climb so easily. I usually have more stronger powers, but after being shrunk the first time, I can't seem to summon them."

"I didn't know." Robin said. "I hope we can get you your powers back after we all grow back to normal size.."

"Yes, thank you." Rosalina smiled. "Are you ready? The key is right over there."

"Yeah, let's get it." Robin said.

Robin and Rosalina walk the small distance to where the key is, it's inside a small cage that's hanging a couple of inches off the ground, suspended by a long piece of string. The cage itself doesn't have any clear way to open it, though. Robin fiddles with the cage for a while, trying to open it.

"Hmm, looks like we might have to smash it open." Robin says to Rosalina.

"Let me try." Rosalina offers. "I should be able to give myself enough force to break it by stepping on it."

"You can do that?" Robin asks.

"I can try." Rosalina says.

Robin yanks the cage off of the string that holds it up and puts the cage on the floor. Rosalina then lifts her foot up and concentrates on smashing the small cage, she grinds the heel of her foot onto it with all her strength, she feels it crack, and then smash completely under her weight!

"You did it! Good work, Rosalina!" Robin congratulates her.

Rosalina smiles at the tactician. "But it's strange." She says. "I wasn't able to change my weight at all for that."

"What do mean? It worked!" Robin asks.

"It did work, yes." Rosalina says. "But that was just from my normal strength alone... I suppose I can't tap into that power on command anymore either..." Rosalina looked sad.

Robin saw how upset Rosalina looked after her confession. He couldn't stand to her like that, so he put an arm around her and tried to cheer her up.

"Don't be sad, Rosalina." Robin told her reassuringly. "We'll help you get your powers back soon! And look," He bends down to pick up the key. "We got the key!"

"Yes. All right. Thank you, Robin." Rosalina smiles.

"Now, come on, let's climb back down." Robin says.

"Yes, I'm right behind you." Rosalina says.

The two then make the long trek back down the table the same way they came up. It takes several minutes before they're back on the floor with the others. Robin flashes the key to the rest of the group and, after some congratulatory responses, the group head to the small door on the other side of the room and open it. Peach and Zelda, the two smallest members of the shrunken group of people, are the only ones able to fit inside, so they have to go it together.

Inside the door, they find...

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Peach and Zelda make their way through the trap-filled room with relative ease. Zelda rides Peach piggyback style (she just happened to be the perfect size for it, and Peach also liked the feeling of Zelda's breasts on her back) and gives the larger woman instructions on how to traverse the various traps in the room. Zelda's quite familiar with such things, having been in plenty of dungeons in her time, and even though her castle has changed quite a bit since before, she's still able to guide Peach through this room effectively.

Working together, the two avoid perilous falls, pressure activated plates in the floor like the one at the entrance, and a number of other dangerous tricks and traps waiting for them. The room is quite small, but the traps in it take the girls some time to avoid.

The two continue to the end of the room, moving very cautiously, and in several minutes time, they make it. They find that the switch is more suited for someone of Peach's size. Peach lets Zelda off her back.

"Thank goodness we made it!" Peach exclaims.

"Yes. I couldn't have done it without you, Peach. So, thank you." Zelda says.

"Aww, no way!" Peach says very bashfully, and blushing a little at Zelda's compliment. "You're the reason we made it!"

Zelda laughs lightly at her friend's bashfulness. "We both did a good job, how about that?" She asks, smiling.

"Yeah!" Peach says.

"Anyways, I think that's it for the traps, I don't see any obvious ones here." Zelda tells Peach. "But be careful of that switch! We need to be prepared in case something happens when you press it."

"Okay.." Peach says. The blonde princess approaches the switch cautiously. She raises her finger to press it. "Here I go..." She says, then presses the switch down.

The switch goes down with a click. Zelda and Peach don't see anything happen though.

"Do I have to press it again?" Peach asks.

Then, the two suddenly hear Robin's voice coming from outside the room. "Hey, you did it!" He shouts. "Part of the wall just opened up, and there's a door behind it!"

"Did you hear that?" Zelda asks.

"It sounds like something opened in the other room." Peach replies.

"Let's go!" Zelda says.

"Okay!" Peach nods at the smaller princess, and picks her up again. The two then proceed to make their way out of the room in the same way they made it to the switch, with Peach carrying the tinier Zelda on her back.

Zelda and Peach make it out in no time and meet up with the rest of the shrunken group.

"Thank god you're okay!" Lucina exclaims upon seeing her friends return. She runs over to Zelda's side, asking the Hyrulean princess for details about what happened in the small room. Zelda is happy to answer all the questions her larger friend has to ask.

Peach looks at the two and smiles, then turns to Robin and asks. "Hey, so what happened out here?"

"Take a look." Robin says.

The tactician points to behind himself, to the piece of wall that opened up. It's as he said before, there's a door there. One that is...

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Zelda stepped on the tile, never once thinking it to be a trap. As soon as her foot touched the yellow space, Zelda instantly shrank down even further! She appeared to vanish into thin air by her companions perspective. One second she was there, the next she was gone. The poor Hyrulean princess never even had time to react.

Everyone gasped in horror as Zelda vanished. She was gone so quickly it was unreal, but they all had an idea of what had happened to her, she had actually shrunk yet again, this time to an unbelievably tiny size! No one could even see any sign of her anymore, not even Peach, the second smallest member of the group could make Zelda out. Peach and Lucina rushed to the space, being careful not to touch it out of fear of shrinking again. The two looked for her more closely, but couldn't see anything, not even a speck. Lucina and Peach broke down crying, as Robin and Rosalina watched with sorrow of their own.

"N-No! NO!" Lucina cries, actually feeling her eyes well up. She looked up to the two largest people. "This wasn't supposed to happen! She was supposed to grow, l-like with the yellow potion.. I thought it would be the same!" Lucina hung her head in shame.

Robin and Rosalina looked down at Lucina with pity. Robin especially felt bed for his girlfriend, he knew she did what she did out of kindness, only to have it backfire horribly. The white haired tactician knelt down at Lucina's side.

"I'm sorry, Lucina." He told her quietly. "You did what you thought you had to do... no one could have predicted... this." Robin clenched his fist in anger. "Damn that Master Hand! He set this trap up, knowing we'd think it would grow her!" He shouted.

Lucina looked up at Robin with a most sorrowful expression. She held him close and collapsed herself on him, crying more.

Peach was tearing up as well over the presumed loss of her dear friend. She sat cross-legged on the ground, crying into her hands. She felt an itch just then, one she'd normally just scratch and be done with, but something felt strange about this, like it was a tiny hand touching her. Peach looked down through her tears, and sure enough, she found an incredibly tiny princess Zelda by her leg. Peach gasped at her find, she then smiled happily and wiped her tears away before moving onto all fours and inspecting the speck in front of her.

"Everyone, look!" Peach exclaimed with great joy. She had confirmed for herself that this speck was none other than princess Zelda herself, only, reduced to a truly microscopic size!

---

Zelda was relieved to have finally been found. She had been trying to get Peach's attention for some time now.

After she shrank on the tile and saw how big everything was to her now, she felt sick at the sight, it was almost incomprehensible to her. But then, she heard Lucina start to cry, the blue haired swordswoman towered over her like like a mountain now, but Zelda felt sad at seeing her new friend so sad. As she listened, she understood that the rest of the group had thought her lost, shrunken to nothing, and while that was almost true, Zelda was still there, and she just had to get their attention.

So Zelda ran over to the next smallest member of the group, Peach, to get her attention. She figured that Peach could at least be able to see her. But if Peach couldn't see her, then she'd surely be doomed!

She ran over the gigantic Mushroom Kingdom princess, who also looked like a mountain to Zelda - a smaller mountain, but a mountain none-the-less, making Zelda feel like a speck even to the 12 mm tall woman. Zelda shouted and waved her arms, jumping up and down to get Peach's attention.

She tried for a couple minutes to no avail until she stopped, thinking a new approach necessary. Zelda remembered how the shrunken group got her attention after she accidentally shrank them a second time. Zelda touched Peach's bare leg, rubbing and scratching it to get a reaction.

And now, Zelda had indeed been found at last. Peach was looking at her intently, Zelda thought the blonde princess's face akin to the size of a house, she could feel her every breath. Then she screamed as two giant-sized fingers plucked her up into the air, where she looked eye-to-eye with Peach.

"Zelda, thank god you're all right!" Peach whispered to the tinier woman. "Can you hear me?" She asked.

"Y-Yes, Peach! I-I can hear you!" Zelda shouted as loud as she could, fearing she might not be heard.

Peach...
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.title: It's a trap!

choices: They are able to fine the right door.
One of them trips and falls on a colored tile that is not white.
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Zelda hopes of being heard are fleeting until Peach opens her mouth to says.

"I can hear you. But just barely," Peach whispers to the much tinier woman, the mushroom kingdom princess then uses her free hand and opens it up and put Zelda on the palm of her hand. Zelda is happy that Peach is able to hear her.

"Zelda is really alright?" Lucina asks as the blue hair woman moves towards Peach. The mushroom princes nods and points at the palm of her hand.

"Just be careful. We don't want to hurt her with our voices," Peach said kindly as Lucina goes looks over Peach. The Blue hair woman stares at Peach's palm and does see Zelda, but just barely!

"I'm so sorry Zelda," Lucina whispers as quietly to the tiniest princess. Lucina heard some squeaks from Peach palm but could not understand what Zelda is say.

"She's saying its okay Lucy. She's just glad she's still here," Peach explaining what Zelda squeaks are to the Blue hair woman. Lucina nods with a smile.

Robin and Rosalina are both smiling at finding out that Zelda is still with them. The two largest members knew it would unlikely for them to be able to see or hear the incredible tiny Zelda. Robin looks at the floor tiles ahead and notice that yellow tiles have changed color! The once yellow tiles are now white.

"Could that mean that white does nothing?" Robin thought as he goes over to a white tile and wonders if he should touch it.

"You're having the same thought as me about the white tiles?" Rosalina asks as the space princess joins Robin at looking the new white tiles.

"Yes. I think they will do nothing to the person who steps on them. I think I'll test it out," Robin explains his plan to Rosalina.

"I understand. Just be careful," Rosalina said to Robin, not wanting Robin to join Zelda in size or even shrink even further. Robin nods as he takes a step on a white tile.

Lucina was too busy being happy about Zelda not being gone to notice what her boyfriend is doing. When the blue hair swords woman sees that Robin is stepping on tile in front of him she becomes scared and runs towards the largest member of the group hopping that nothing happens to him.

"It's been about a minute. Looks like white is safe to touch," Rosalina said after estimating that a minute has pass and because Zelda shrunk instantly from touch a yellow tile, it meant Robin and her theory on the white tile is correct.

"Robin!" Lucina shouts as the swords woman makes it over to the white hair tactician.

"I'm sorry Lucina. I had to make sure that the white tile was safe to use," Robin replies to the two inch woman. "It will alright. I'm sorry for worrying you," Robin kneels down to look Lucina in the eyes and give the tiny woman a smile. Lucina sighs and kisses her boyfriend on the lips despite their height difference.

"You better keep your word," Lucina adds with a little blush on her face. Robin nods as Peach comes over still carrying Zelda on the palm of her hand.

"Robin and I will be crossing floor. Since we're big enough to jump over the other colors and try to check the doors," Rosalina explains what Robin and her are going to do.

"Okay," Peach said agreeing with the plan as Zelda makes squeaks. "Oh! Zelda says to be careful,"

"We will Zelda," Robin agreeing with princess wishes.

Robin and Rosalina start to move across the floor and hope they can find the right door. While the two move.....

While Lucina, Peach and Zelda watch Robin and Rosalina walk across the room and hope that one of them is able to find the right door. Time seem to go slowly for the group as Robin and Rosalina walk slowly across the room.

"I hope nothing bad happens," Zelda thought not wanting another person to join her at this size.

Unfortunately for the tiniest member her prayers were not answered as one of the larger members of the group trip.

Lucina is shock to as it seems.......
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.title: Someone fell but who and what color is it?

choices: Picks Rosalina up and carries her with him
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Rosalina had tripped, landing on a red tile. She flinched, thinking she might shrink to Zelda's size, or smaller! She couldn't imagine anything good possibly coming from this.

"Rosalina!" Robin shouted, stopping his own progress to see what happened.

"I'm sorry, I tripped." Rosalina said, rather calmly.

Rosalina was puzzled, she expected something to happen to her quickly, like with Zelda. But she had been on the tile for several seconds now, and nothing. The platinum blonde was surprised when she was even able to get back up to her feet.

"I'm okay." Rosalina said.

Everyone was relieved that Rosalina seemed to have gotten lucky. But then, the part of the tile that the cosmic princess wasn't standing on opened up! Rosalina was shocked by this. She didn't have time to react as she was suddenly assaulted with ropes, covering her body and wrapping around most of her body below her neck, and trapping her arms behind her. The tile then closed back up and turned white.

In her suddenly tied up state, Rosalina helplessly fell face-forward to the ground. She squirmed, trying to get free, but to no avail, her bindings were on too tight to give any leeway.

"R-Robin, please, help me!" Rosalina cried from her prone position on the floor.

"Hold on, I'm coming!" Robin said with urgency.

Luckily for Rosalina, Robin was already well on his way as soon as the ropes came out. He was at her side in no time, trying to untie her. The tactician had dealt with many a rope before, not always for tieing people up though, so he was confident he'd be able to untangle Rosalina. He tried for several anguishing minutes, and every time it seemed like he might be close to getting one knot undone, it just seemed to keep going!

"What's going on? Is there something wrong?" Rosalina asked. Despite her situation, she still sounded rather calm, a little less so, but only a little.

"It's not coming undone! What is this!?" Robin shouted. He thought Zelda might understand, so he shouted louder. "Zelda! Can you hear me? Rosalina's been tied up, and the rope seems impossible to undo!"

Robin saw Peach talk to the tiny, tiny Zelda in her hand for a few seconds, before getting an answer courtesy of Peach.

"Zelda says she doesn't know, she thinks it might be illusion magic!" Peach shouts.

"Illusion magic!?" Robin muses over the idea. "Then what does that mean..?"

"... it means you can't help me." Rosalina said softly, squirming around a little to face Robin.

"What!?" Robin exclaimed. "There must be a way, I just have to try again!" Robin went back to trying to untie Rosalina's bindings.

Rosalina sighed in defeat. "You can't do it by force, Robin." Rosalina explained. "The illusion will make you think you're getting close, but in reality, you're not any closer to untying me then when you started! Do you understand, it's an illusion!"

"D-Damn!" Robin shouted. "T-Then what will you do?"

"You have to leave me and go on ahead." Rosalina said in a matter of fact tone. "I'll be fine here."

Robin stopped trying to untie Rosalina for a moment to look her in the eyes, she looked serious. But Robin didn't want to leave Rosalina behind! He couldn't lose another teammate again, he already lost Zelda in a way...

Robin...
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.title: Rosalina lands on red and gets roped!

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
"Rosalina, I'm sorry.." Robin began quietly. He then stood up tall and exclaimed, "But I can't do that!"

"Robin, please, it's no use. I'll just get in your way!" Rosalina shouted.

Robin shook his head. He leaned down and, in an act that surprised Rosalina, he picked up the cosmic princess and hefted her over his shoulder. He may be small now, but Robin was still strong enough to help Rosalina up, more or less.

"R-Robin, what are you doing!?" Rosalina exclaimed.

"We're going to make it through this, together!" Robin said triumphantly.

Rosalina let out a sigh, in happiness this time, and smiled. She couldn't help but feel like she was being carried off by a villain though, what with her dangling off of Robin's shoulder and in tight bondage. She stifled a laugh at the thought, and got herself into as comfortable a position as she possibly could. She then saw Robin looking at her.

"Are you good?" Robin asked, knowing it was kind of a pointless question.

She nodded at Robin. "Yes, Thank you." She said.

With Rosalina over his shoulder, Robin continued to cross the tiled floor. The tactician made sure to go more carefully now, but he had to go slower, carrying Rosalina had the unfortunate side-effect of making him move slower.

"Look at them go!" Lucina says as she watches Robin and Rosalina make it across the room.

"Yeah, they're doing great! Go guys!" Peach exclaims.

"I was so worried when Rosalina get trapped like that!" Lucina admits. "But now, Robin is able to carry both them across the floor. Heh, it's just like him."

"Hmm?" Peach whispers, Zelda was speaking to her again. "Oh, Zelda says that Robin is a good man." Peach says for the tiniest princess.

"Yes, he is." Lucina nods.

Robin was making decent progress, all hindrances aside. Rosalina was even feeling good about this, she just wished she was out of this rope, though!

Robin and Rosalina were close to the end, when Robin felt his grip on Rosalina start to falter, unfortunately at this time he was also stepping over one of the colored tiles. He acted quickly, and recklessly, jerking his body back to the white space he came from. It knocked him off balance though, and...
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.title: Carrying Rosalina the rest of the way

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Luckily Robin's tacit works and is able to save Rosalina from landing on another colored tile but unfortunately the same could not be same for him. The white hair tactician falls onto a green tile. This cause all of the girls to fear for Robin's safety from falling on the green tile. All of the green tiles now turn into white tiles.

"Robin! Is everything alright!" Rosalina yells hoping that Robin will respond. The way Robin saved her was to push from falling on a black tile.

"I'm fine. But something feels strange," Robin replies as he gets up, the girls sigh in relief but notice something is strange with the tactician looks around and seems confuse.

"Robin! What's wrong?" Lucina yells her question as loud as her lungs could let her.

"I-I can't see anything!" Robin shouts back to his girlfriend. "Everything is dark,"

Rosalina moves her body so the space princess can look into Robin's eyes and is shock to see Robin's eyes are now milky. Rosalina is shock that Master Hand could even more a trap like this!

"H-He's blind!" Rosalina shouts after confirming what happen to Robin.

"Blind!" Zelda shouts, the princess of Hyrule couldn't believe that Master Hand could be that evil.

"It will be okay. There must a cure somewhere," Peach said trying her best to be positive.

"That's right. We have to move forward," Robin said as he takes a breath. "Rosalina could you help me out? I need someone to be my eyes."

"I'll try my best," Rosalina agreeing to help the white hair man.

Lucina felt frustrated at not being to help, the swords woman watches as her boyfriend tries to move towards Rosalina as the space princess continues to talk. Lucina looks to see that she could possible get to Robin and help him. The two inch swords woman would be easier to carry for Robin and not weight him down. Lucina......
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.title: Robin's world becomes darkness

choices: They somehow make it across without any more problems
Another fall! One of them activates a tile...
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Lucina wanted to help Robin out. But the risk was too high, and she was too small. Too small to make the jump across the tiles, and even if she could make it across a few, it would only take one mistake to make things harder for her somehow. After seeing how bad things had gotten for anyone who had the misfortune of touching a tile, she was starting to think that there were no beneficial effects that these tiles would bestow on them.

Lucina realized these things and, reluctantly, took a step back from the board. With regret, she now opted to stay with Peach and Zelda, and watch from the sidelines.

Robin, please be careful... Lucina thought.

---

Rosalina guided Robin to her, she still lay helpless and bound, and gave the now blind man directions the best she could. Robin tried to make sense of her commands. It wasn't easy and it was very frustrating to be without sight, but Robin moved slowly and as carefully as he could, never putting a foot down unless Rosalina told him it was absolutely safe.

"Here. Robin, I'm right beneath you." Rosalina told Robin, the young man had followed her commands to the T, and it had payed off. This came as a huge relief to the both of them.

"Oh." Robin said. It was so strange for him not to be able to see, he couldn't even see Rosalina, and she was apparently right in front of him! "Thank you for guiding me, Rosalina. You're my eyes now."

"I know, and you are my feet." Rosalina replied.

"Yeah, we need to work together to do this." Robin said.

"Yes, now, come down and pick me up."

Robin nodded instinctively, not even sure if Rosalina could see it, now that he was standing over her. The white haired tactician slowly lowered his body, holding his hands out to feel for Rosalina. He felt something soft.

"O-Okay, Robin, you've got me.." Rosalina said.

"Oh." Robin replied. Rosalina sounded a little strange, he wondered just what he had grabbed on her. He mentally shrugged it off and lowered his reach further, to heft her up and over his shoulder again. Rosalina let out a few squeaks during this time.

"I'm sorry if I grab you wrong." Robin whispered to her. "... but, blind, remember?"

"N-No, it's alright." Rosalina assured him hastily. "Now, just pick me up."

Robin did so, carrying her over his shoulder like before.

"Um, are you facing the right way?" Robin asked.

"Yes, I can see ahead of us." Rosalina said. "There's only a few more tiles until the end. We can do this, we just have to work together."

"Okay! Lead the way!" Robin said.

Next...

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Lucina, Peach and Zelda watch as Rosalina give Robin direction of how to move. It amazed Lucina at how well Robin could take direction, normally he would be the one to tell other directions. After thirty minutes of Robin and Rosalina working together they are near the other side of the room.

"Okay, You just need move forward and you're in the clear," Rosalina explains and Robin nods in agreement. The tactician moves forward and the two made it across with no other problems.

"We've final made it," Robin says with a smile. "Thank you for your help Rosalina,"

"It's no trouble. Thank you for helping me," Rosalina said mentioning how she is bound.

"Your welcome. So how many doors are there on this side?" Robin asks not remembering how many doors are on this side of the room.

"There are two doors. A left door and right door. Luckily they are both our size," Rosalina answers the tactician. 'Which door would you like to go through?"

Robin takes a moment to think about which door to take door to take. Would his luck be good this time around? After a few more minutes of thinking Robin answers.....
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.title: Robin and Rosalina make it across and doors.

choices: The other door was still there waiting to be opened
The other door had disappeared, leaving just the wall
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
"Let's try the right door." Robin said.

"Okay, here's how we'll get there..." Rosalina went on to give Robin more instructions on how to move about the room.

In a few minutes, they were there. With Rosalina's help, Robin opened the door and the two went inside. When Rosalina's bindings got too be a little too uncomfortable for her.

"Unn..! This is very uncomfortable..!" Rosalina complained.

"I'm sorry, Rosalina." Robin said. "I wish there was something I could do about those ropes."

"It's alright, I know." Rosalina replied with a weak smile, one that Robin couldn't see. Rosalina then looked around the room, it was a small hallway with a pedestal in the middle and another door on the other side. There was also a button on the side of the wall where they came in from. "Robin, there's a door on the other side of this room. There's a button on the wall too. There's also something on a pedestal in the middle of this room, walk forward and I'll tell you when you get there."

"Okay." Robin said, and started to walk slowly ahead.

"Okay, stop now, please." Rosalina said, after a minute. Robin froze in his tracks as soon as she said so. "It's right in front of you, let me see..."

Rosalina looked at the object on the pedestal. It was another bottle, a star shaped one this time, with a blue liquid inside, it reminded Rosalina of a blue luma a little. There was a note on the bottle as well, it read: "EYE DROPS"

Rosalina gasped upon reading it. "Robin! These are eye drops!" She exclaimed.

"What? Where?" Robin asked, standing completely still.

"They're in a bottle on the pedestal right in front of you." Rosalina explained to him. "You're going to have to put me down and try them for yourself."

"Okay, hold on." Robin said.

Robin slowly lowered Rosalina gently to the floor, he placed her just at his side. Rosalina felt uncomfortable again, but persisted. She gave Robin a more detailed explanation of what was in front of him. With her help, Robin was able to grab the bottle and open it.

Robin then poured the drops into his eyes, one on each, and in a few seconds, his vision started to come back! It was blurry at first, but he somehow knew it would get better.

"It's working! Rosalina, I can see again!" Robin exclaimed.

"That's great, Robin! I'm happy for you!" Rosalina cheered from the floor.

Rosalina was happy for Robin, but couldn't help feeling sad for herself, as she was still tied up. She was glad that Robin got cured first though, if there were eye drops in here for him, then there may have been a sharp object for cutting her ropes. Having a blind Robin try and cut away at her ropes was something she didn't want, and she was glad, in a way. Then she thought about it... the other door!

"Robin!" Rosalina shouted up at the tactician.

"What's up?" Robin asked nonchalant. He was still getting used to being able to see again. He smiled as he finally was able to see Rosalina's body clearly again.

"I think there might be something to help me behind the other door!" Rosalina exclaimed.

Robin's eyes lit up at the thought. "Of course! Hold on, I'll get us there." Robin said.

Robin got down and grabbed Rosalina's tightly bound body and picked her up, this time holding her in a sort of princess carry, although she couldn't hold on to him. Rosalina looked up at him from his arms and smiled.

"Thank you." Rosalina said. "This is much better." She sort of snuggled into him, as much as she could in her binds.

"Of course." Robin replied with a smile. "I'll take care of you."

Robin and Rosalina then left the room and went to check on the other door. Once outside, they saw...

On the other side of the side of the room, Lucina sees that Robin is able to see again. The blue hair woman smiles and some tears of joy come out of her eyes.

"Man Rosie is lucky. I want Robin to carry me like that too," Peach said seeing that Robin is carrying Rosalina a bridal style. After this dungeon the mushroom kingdom princess has to get Robin to carry like that.

"I see that your thinking of a plan Peach," Zelda thought as the hyrule princess thought but is happy to see that one of her friends is cured from one of the tiles of this room.

"I hope so too," Robin said, hoping he can help Rosalina since the space princess help him when he was blind.

Robin goes forward and is now in front of the chest. The white hair tactician puts the space princess on the ground trying to make as comfortable as possible for Rosalina. Robin then opens the chest and finds.....

The door to lock, Robin is now trapped in the room!
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
"It's a key of some sort." Robin said.

"A key?" Rosalina mused over that. "Maybe it's the key to the boss room?"

"Boss room?"

"Yes. Peach told me about it, she heard it from Zelda. Apparently in this world, there are many dungeons, like the one we're in now, and to reach the final enemy and complete said dungeon, you usually have to get the key to enter the boss's chambers." Rosalina explained.

"I see. So that means we're near the end of this dungeon." Robin said. But then felt bad for Rosalina, she was still tied up with no way to undo her binds. "I'm sorry that it wasn't something to help you, Rosalina."

Rosalina shook her head. "But, Robin, this will help me." She said. "Once we beat this boss, then I'm sure there will be a way for me to get out of these ropes."

"Yeah, I hope so." Robin said. He paused for a second, then continued with, "But where do we use this key?"

"That room with the eye drops had a door in it, I'm not sure since I didn't get a close look at it, but there may be a lock on it." Rosalina told him. "Maybe we should try there?" Her and Robin contemplated it for a moment. "And, come on, just pick me up already!" Rosalina said with a laugh. "This is very uncomfortable, you know!"

"Oh! I'm sorry!" Robin said hastily. He picked up Rosalina in the same way as before, she seemed much more comfortable while he was holding her. She snuggled up against him again, "There was also a button in that room, do you think we should try that out?"

"A button?" Robin asked. "It could be another trap. But yes, I'll try it. Alone, though, just in case."

Robin then took Rosalina out of the room with the chest and back into the tiled room. He saw Lucina and Peach on the other side of the room, not noticing Zelda because she was far too small to see at this distance.

"Robin!" Lucina shouted from across the room. "Did you find something good!? Did you find a way for us to get over to you yet!?"

"Not yet!" Robin shouted his response. "But I'm going to try something that might help, hold on!" Robin looked down at Rosalina in his arms, he said to her, "I'm sorry to have to leave you here, but I don't want to take any risks."

"That's fine. I understand." Rosalina said.

Robin then gently placed Rosalina on the floor, and went back into the eye drop room. He wasted no time in pressing the button on the wall, which caused...
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.title: Nah, nah, nah-naaah!

choices: "There is a lock on the door," The next room is the boss room.
"There's not a lock on the door," There is still more dungeon to get through.
1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
Robin stood for a couple of seconds and wonders if the button even did anything. The white hair tactician got his answer from a yell behind him.

"Robin! The remaining colored tiles have become white!" Rosalina shouts and is happy to see her smaller friends walking across the floor. Robin sighs in relief as he goes out to greet everyone.

"It's good to see everyone made it across alright," Robin said as he enters the room and kneels down.

"I'm glad you're alright," Lucina said as the blue hair woman hugs Robin's leg and in turn Robin hugs the swords woman with his hand.

"Sorry that you're still all tie up Rosie," Peach said as the mushroom kingdom princess gets close to her friend. Rosalina then heard squeaks coming from Peach's hand. "Zelda says she'll get you untied once we get back to normal," Peach helps Zelda to be heard.

"Thank you Peach and Zelda. I appreciate it," Rosalina replies and looks over to Robin. "Robin, was the door in that hallway locked in any way?"

"Oh! I'm sorry I didn't check. I'll go and check it out right now," Robin said as Lucina and him separate and the white hair tactician runs back in the right door again.

"Why would the door to the next room be lock? Did you two find a key?" Lucina asks after figuring that must be why the space princess ask Robin about that door being lock.

"Yes. Robin and I found a Boss Key," Rosalina answers the swords woman question.

"No! We shrunk again!" Lucina cries.

"This is awful.." Zelda says softly, having gotten used to being almost normal sized, shrinking back down to such a small size is quite the heartbreak for the Hyrulean princess.

"So it's going to happen everytime we go through the portal." Robin states.

"It looks that way." Rosalina says. "Although I hope it's not true, maybe next time we'll get lucky..?"

"Hmm." Peach says simply, smiling to herself. She seemed to be enjoying this.

Despite the most recent reduction in size, everyone is able to stay cool and clear-headed about the whole thing. Partly because they don't know just how small they've become. During this time, it becomes clear, Samus is nowhere to be found in the immediate area, so the group just takes a look around.

"So this is the home of the legendary Samus Aran?" Lucina asks.

"It's a lot bigger than I remember." Peach says.

"Everything is bigger now, Peach." Zelda says. "How small do you think we are anyway?"

"I'd say about..." Robin thinks it over quickly. "A millimeter tall, yeah, about that."

"Only a millimeter!?" Lucina gasps. "That's ridiculous! H-How big would Samus be then-"

*THUMP*

"What was that!?" Lucina asked.

The loud, thundering sound alone was nearly enough to knock the shrunken people off their feet. Suddenly, a huge, metallic leg came down right in front of the tiny group, knocking them into the air slightly.

"W-Whoa! Is that..!?" Peach stammered out, but couldn't finish her thoughts once she saw the gigantic being before her and the rest of the shrunken group.

The orange plated leg piece of the metallic suit stretched way up into the sky, connecting to an even bigger giant than they'd ever seen! The giant appeared to them to be over a mile tall, wearing a familiar orange suit. From that, it was clear that the giant, or giantess rather, was none other than Samus Aran, the famous bounty hunter. Only, now magnified to mountainous proportions to the shrunken group.

The sight left the group in shock and awe, all expect for Zelda, who was mostly unaffected since she'd been even smaller than this before, but even she was amazed at the pure difference in scale Samus' and the team's size allotted.

---

Samus strode pass the tiny group, unaware of their presence on her ship, to the pilot seat of her star ship, where she sat down. She placed her meal, which she had just gotten out of her in-ship microwave, and relaxed in her chair.

It's nice to get some downtime after completing a bounty.. Samus thought. But it's been so long, I just wonder if anything interesting is going to happen soon.

Samus took a bite of her meal, and a sip of her drink, and turned her attention to the ship's screen in front of her.

"I really shouldn't complain though." Samus groaned, speaking her thoughts aloud now. "At least the space pirates aren't screwing things up right now."

---

"My god, she's huge!" Lucina exclaimed, at last recovering from the shock of seeing someone so large.

"Yes, I.. never expected being so small could make for such an incredible difference..." Rosalina said.

"Zelda, is this what it was like for you?" Robin asked out of curiosity

"Yes, it was, something like this.." Zelda replied.

"Wow, that's so crazy!" Peach said, in an odd, almost excited tone.

"Peach, you can't seriously think this is cool?" Lucina asked.

"Why not?" Peach asked her, genuinely confused at the others shock from before. She didn't get it, she thought it was incredible to be this small. "This should be fun! Sammy and I are good friends too, you know!"

"Sammy, seriously..?" Lucina said quietly.

"Well, anyways, we need a plan." Zelda said. "We need to find a way to get her attention."

"I agree." Rosalina agreed. "From the way she's sitting down now, and what she said before, it seems like she's taking a break right now. If we're going to do something, now is the time."

"Yeah, but do you really want to be anywhere near her at her sizes?" Lucina asks.

"It might be dangerous, but it also might be our best chance at getting her to notice us." Robin says.

The group thinks about how to proceed...

1252111212211112121121121112111111112211.content:
There's a hole on the foot portion of Samus' suit. The group doesn't quite notice it just yet though, they're all too amazed at the giantess before them. Just Samus' leg stretches far up into the sky, from their viewpoint on the floor, none of the shrunken people can even see past it!

"Okay, so this is going to be a little tricky." Robin says. "We'll have to climb from the outside of her suit, all the way up to her visor. That's how this is going to go, alright?"

"Robin, wait!" Zelda shouts. "Look! There's a hole in her foot!"

Robin turns and looks, and sees that Zelda is right, there is indeed a small hole in the very bottom of Samus' power suit, it looks big enough for the shrunken people to fit inside.

"Do you think we can go in there?" Lucina asks.

"It might be easier to climb her from inside her suit." Rosalina adds.

"Yes, I think that's right." Robin agrees. "Okay, people! Change of plans, we'll climb her from the inside of her suit!"

"I don't know if you all know..." Zelda says to the newer smashers. "But Samus often wears her Zero Suit below her armor, it's a tight, light-blue full body suit that she says helps her move easier. I say that it'll help us climb her easier if we climb up the Zero Suit."

"Great..!" Robin says, blushing a little at the thought of climbing Samus in her Zero Suit. Even though he was a new smasher, Samus' beauty was well known, even to him. So he had an idea of what to expect. "Then, uh, that's what we'll do!"

"Oooh, this should be fun!" Peach says, nearly squealing at the thought.

Lucina notices Peach's reaction and thinks, Oh, great. Now she might be right about before...

"Come on, girls, we don't have time to lose!" Robin says. "We have to get her attention before Master Hand puts his plans into motion again!"

"Alright!" The girls' all agreed.

The group crawls inside the hole of Samus' armor, through a small part of machinery, and eventually come out to a more open space. There they see a huge wall of light-blue, the skin-tight Zero Suit, they realize, higher up they see very well-toned and feminine legs stretching far above, covered in the same form-fitting blue suit. It's harder to see anything higher than that though, as the narrow space between the armor and Samus herself doesn't allow for much room.

The space inside the armor is tight, now leaving much room for even the millimeter tall people to move around. It's basically just Samus' body and the armor she wears, an almost skin-tight armor on skin-tight jumpsuit.

"W-Wow, this is it then..." Robin says, his mouth stands agape for a moment in awe.

"I'm just surprised we even made it through that tiny hole at all!" Lucina says, more worried about getting Samus' attention.

"Oh my..." Is all Rosalina can say upon seeing Samus' towering legs so up-close. The platinum-blonde sees that the group's work is cut out for them.

"Hey, look at that!" Peach exclaims. She runs over to Samus' blue-clad foot and hugs it. "It's Samus, everybody!"

"They know, Peach." Zelda says a laugh. "It's an incredible sight, to be sure, but we need to focus on climbing her body."

"Oh! That should be fun!" Peach says happily, before quickly climbing up Samus' foot.

"Well, at least we know one thing now." Lucina says.

"What's that?" Robin asks.

"Samus won't be able to feel us at all." Lucina explains. "She didn't seem to feel Peach at all, even after she hugged her toes. So she probably won't be able to feel us."

"Hmm, I see." Robin says. "In that case, nothing has changed, we still need to get to her face, her eyes probably, so she'll see us and we can warn her about Master Hand's plans to shrink her!"

"Yeah." Lucina agrees.

"But first.." Zelda says. "Don't you think we should catch up to Peach?"

Robin and Lucina look and see that Peach is already climbing on the bounty hunter's shin, and shows no signs of stopping.

"Okay, then... let's go!" Robin says.

And with that, the shrunken group all get ready to climb the towering form of Samus Aran...

"Ha ha, not before today!" Robin replies heartily. "And to have to do it twice, no less!"

Robin and Lucina shared some more laughs and conversation together while relaxing on the giantess Samus's thigh. Zelda, meanwhile, was closer to Samus's waist. The giantess was sitting down, meaning a climb straight up would be all that's left for the shrunken, millimeter tall group to reach her face.

The Hyrulean princess was craning her neck up to see just how far there was to go, she wasn't expecting much due to her small size though, so she wasn't too surprised to see that she couldn't see! Samus's large breasts blocked her view. Zelda blushed as she saw them high above her.

"Thinking of something.. fun, Zelly?" Peach asked in a teasing tone.

Zelda turned to see Peach, and the rest the group coming her way. "We've got a long way to go." She told Peach, trying to brush off her crude friend's question. "I don't think it should take us too long though. Are we all ready to go, then?"

"Yeah, seems like it." Peach replied. "Everyone's ready to go, and after only a few minutes too!" Peach pouted. "Boo! I wanted to have some fun!"

"Fun?" Zelda asked. She was honestly not sure how being so small and having to climb another person's body could be considered "fun".

"Yeeesss..! You must've had some thoughts by now, right?" Peach asked her. But Zelda just shook her head. Peach scoffed. "Oh, you're clueless, Zelly!" She exclaimed. "And after all we've done together..." She whispered.

Zelda's face lit up with realization of what Peach meant at last. She raised a hand over her mouth, and blushed. "Sex...? Here..?" She asked softly.

"Now you get it!" Peach said happily, smirking.

Peach beamed at the question, she was horny now, and wanted to see if the rest of the group was willing. She nearly forgot about how much danger Samus was in, let alone herself! Zelda wasn't so sure though, she wanted to keep going, knowing any distractions could lead to Samus being shrunk down too. She tried to explain the situation to Robin and the others...
